# Quick Tables


Extracted From:
  • Gitlab - Git Cheat Sheet (opens new window)

# Quick tables | Git Configuration

Description Code
user configuration 
 
 git config --global user.name “Your Name”
 git config --global user.email “you@example.com”
 git config --global color.ui auto

# Quick tables | Starting A Project

Description Code
git init git init [project name]
git clone git clone [project url]

# Quick tables | Day-To-Day Work

Description Code
Check Status 
 
git status
git add [file]
git diff [file]
git diff --staged [file] // Difference with the repository
Checkout: Discarding Directory Discard changes in working directory. This operation is unrecoverable
git checkout -- [file]
Reset Revert your repository to a previous known working state
git reset [file]

# Quick tables | Git branching model

Description Code
List all local branches With -a: show all branches (with remote).
git branch [-a]
New Branch git branch [branch_name]
Switch Branch Switch working directory to the specified branch. With -b: Git will create the specified branch if it does not exist
git checkout [-b][branch_name]
Delete Branch Remove selected branch, if it is already merged into any other. -D instead of -d forces deletion
git branch -d [name]
Merge Branch Join specified [from name] branch into your current branch (the one you are on currently).
git merge [from name]
